result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[ma] Case called at 9:21 AM 
Defendant Shannon A Lentz in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court vacates warrant authorization.

As to Amended Complaint:   
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.

Ms. Lentz waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial, but DA Hall requests a trial be scheduled
recess: 9:27am 

NEXT:   (1) FSSC on 9/13/22 at 3:30pm (2)Jury Trial on 9/19/22 at 8:15am

Initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Waiver of Prelim on April 11, 2022 at 08:45 am.

[MK] case #22CF124 called at 8:38am 
Defendant Shannon A Lentz does not appear. Attorney Steven Luchsinger appears. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for both Initial Appearance and Preliminary Hearing today,  The State's officer is present.  However Attorney Luchsinger indicates that Ms. Lentz is unable to appear because her child is ill.  Attorney Luchsinger requests rescheduling of the hearing to Monday morning when Ms. Lentz will be able to appear.  Attorney Luchsinger indicates that the Defense intent is to waive preliminary hearing rights.
The Court authorizes a Warrant, but stays its issuance to the Monday morning hearing time.
recess 8:41am 

NEXT:  Initial Appearance and Prelim-Waiver Hearing on April 11th at 8:45am--JA note in comments that a warrant has been authorized but stayed to this date/time

Initial appearance on April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial on June 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Shannon A Lentz
Current: 897 E Lake St #113, Lake Mills, WI 53551   (Effective: 03-08-2022)
Prior: N7575 Kettle Moraine Dr, Whitewater, WI 53190

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
case called at 9:50am 
Defendant Shannon A Lentz appears by audio-only.  Attorney Steven Luchsinger appears.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is set for Final Status Conference today and for Jury Trial next week.  However Attorney Luchsinger requests trial adjournment, indicating that he learned of a new potential witness last week; time is needed to locate the witness-the witness is at the same workplace, the name of the witness is unknown and efforts are being made to determine the name and then contact the person. 
ADA Shock indicates that, given the Defense recent information, the State will not oppose the adjournment request.
As to the State's 2/21/22 Motion to Amend the Complaint:  
--the Court grants the State leave to amend the Complaint.  However the Court will not act further as to the Amended Complaint today because Ms. Lentz appears by telephone only 
--ADA Shock notes that a preliminary hearing will be needed on the amended charge 
recess 9:56am. 

NEXT:  (1) upon the State filing the Amended Complaint (leave to file was granted by the Court at today's hearing, this case will be re-numbered to a felony case number,  (2) Initial Appearance and Preliminary Hearing on the newly-numbered felony case on April 8th at 8:30am,  (3) FSSC on June 7th at 2:30pm, (4) Jury Trial on June 13th at 8:15am

[ae] [All Appearances via Zoom] case called 11:33 AM Defendant Shannon A Lentz appeared. ADA Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $500  Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1
-no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs) after signing of this bond
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Clerk of Courts Office to sign this Bond by 4:00 pm on 6/25/21

recess 11:41 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/28/21 at 9:00 am   (2) Status Conference on 9/2/21 at 8:30 am
The Court informs the defendant that failure to appear to sign bond will result in a warrant being issued.
